abstracts.cdata!:
The Romania Avian Influenza Control and
            Human Pandemic Preparedness and Response (APL) Project
            supports and constitutes an integral part of a national
            program to increase Romania's avian and human influenza
            preparedness. In this context, the overall development
            objective o f the project is to reduce the threat posed to
            humans and the poultry sector in Romania by Avian Flu and
            other zoonoses, and to support the preparation for, control
            of, and response to influenza pandemics and other infectious
            disease emergencies in humans. The project has three
            components each with multiple sub-components that support
            activities in prevention, preparedness, contingency
            planning, response, and containment. Component 1 focuses on
            animal health: it strengthens veterinary institutions;
            improves Avian Flu prevention and control planning;
            strengthens monitoring and surveillance systems, diagnostic
            capacity, animal diseases information systems, applied
            veterinary research capacity, and Avian flu control
            programs; supports poultry vaccination campaigns; and
            improves bio-security in poultry production and trade.
            Component 2 focuses on human health by enhancing Public
            Health Program Planning and Coordination; and Strengthening
            o f National Public Health Surveillance Systems and the
            health system's response capacity. Component 3 funds
            public awareness, communication, and implementation support.
